 1937: %% Test NIF maps handling.
 1938: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1939:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),
 1940:     Pairs = [{adam, "bert"}] ++
 1941:             [{I,I}||I <- lists:seq(1,10)] ++
 1942: 	    [{a,value},{"a","value"},{<<"a">>,<<"value">>}],
 1943:     ok = ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 1944:     M  = maps_from_list_nif(Pairs),
 1945:     R = {RIs,Is} = sorted_list_from_maps_nif(M),
 1946:     io:format("Pairs: ~p~nMap: ~p~nReturned: ~p~n", [lists:sort(Pairs),M,R]),
 1947:     true = (lists:sort(Is) =:= lists:sort(Pairs)),
 1948:     Is = lists:reverse(RIs),
 1949: 
 1950:     #{} = maps_from_list_nif([]),
 1951:     {[],[]} = sorted_list_from_maps_nif(#{}),
 1952: 
 1953:     1 = is_map_nif(M),
 1954:     0 = is_map_nif("no map"),
 1955: 
 1956:     Msz = map_size(M),
 1957:     {1,Msz} = get_map_size_nif(M),
 1958:     {1,0} = get_map_size_nif(#{}),
 1959:     {0,-123} = get_map_size_nif({#{}}),
 1960: 
 1961:     #{} = M0 = make_new_map_nif(),
 1962: 
 1963:     {1, #{key := value}=M1} = make_map_put_nif(M0, key, value),
 1964:     {1, #{key := value, "key2" := "value2"}=M2} = make_map_put_nif(M1, "key2", "value2"),
 1965:     {1, #{key := "value", "key2" := "value2"}=M3} = make_map_put_nif(M2, key, "value"),
 1966:     {0, undefined} = make_map_put_nif(666, key, value),
 1967: 
 1968:     {1, "value2"} = get_map_value_nif(M3,"key2"),
 1969:     {0, undefined} = get_map_value_nif(M3,"key3"),
 1970:     {0, undefined} = get_map_value_nif(false,key),
 1971: 
 1972:     {0, undefined} = make_map_update_nif(M0, key, value),
 1973:     {0, undefined} = make_map_update_nif(M1, "key2", "value2"),
 1974:     {1, #{key := "value", "key2" := "value2"}} = make_map_update_nif(M2, key, "value"),
 1975:     {0, undefined} = make_map_update_nif(666, key, value),
 1976: 
 1977:     {1, #{}} = make_map_remove_nif(M1, key),
 1978:     {1, M1} = make_map_remove_nif(M2, "key2"),
 1979:     {1, M2} = make_map_remove_nif(M2, "key3"),
 1980:     {0, undefined} = make_map_remove_nif(self(), key),
 1981: 
 1982:     M1 = maps_from_list_nif(maps:to_list(M1)),
 1983:     M2 = maps_from_list_nif(maps:to_list(M2)),
 1984:     M3 = maps_from_list_nif(maps:to_list(M3)),
 1985: 
 1986:     %% Test different map sizes (OTP-15567)
 1987:     repeat_while(fun({35,_}) -> false;
 1988:                     ({K,Map}) ->
 1989:                          Map = maps_from_list_nif(maps:to_list(Map)),
 1990:                          Map = maps:filter(fun(K2,V) -> V =:= K2*100 end, Map),
 1991:                          {K+1, maps:put(K,K*100,Map)}
 1992:                  end,
 1993:                  {1,#{}}),
 1994: 
 1995:     M5 = lists:foldl(fun(N, MapIn) ->
 1996:                              {1, #{N := value}=MapOut} = make_map_put_nif(MapIn, N, value),
 1997:                              MapOut
 1998:                      end,
 1999:                      #{},
 2000:                      lists:seq(1,40)),
 2001:     M6 = lists:foldl(fun(N, MapIn) ->
 2002:                              {1, MapOut} = make_map_remove_nif(MapIn, N),
 2003:                              ok = maps:get(N, MapOut, ok),
 2004:                              MapOut
 2005:                      end,
 2006:                      M5,
 2007:                      lists:seq(1,40)),
 2008:     true = (M6 =:= #{}),
 2009: 
 2010:     has_duplicate_keys = maps_from_list_nif([{1,1},{1,1}]),
 2011: 
 2012:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),
 2013:     ok.
 2014:  
 2015: %% Test macros enif_make_list<N> and enif_make_tuple<N>
 2016: api_macros(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2017:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2018:     Expected = {[lists:seq(1,N) || N <- lists:seq(1,9)],
 2019: 		[list_to_tuple(lists:seq(1,N)) || N <- lists:seq(1,9)]
 2020: 	       },
 2021:     Expected = macros(list_to_tuple(lists:seq(1,9))),
 2022:     ok.
 2023: 
 2024: %% enif_make_[tuple|list]_from_array
 2025: from_array(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2026:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2027:     lists:foreach(fun(Tpl) ->
 2028: 			  Lst = tuple_to_list(Tpl),
 2029: 			  {Lst,Tpl} = tuple_2_list_and_tuple(Tpl)
 2030: 		  end,
 2031: 		  [{}, {1,2,3}, {[4,5],[],{},{6,7}}, {{}}, {[]}]),
 2032:     ok.
 2033: 
 2034: %% enif_inspect_iolist_as_binary
 2035: iolist_as_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2036:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2037:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),
 2038:     List = [<<"hejsan">>, <<>>, [], [17], [<<>>],
 2039: 	    [127,128,255,0],
 2040: 	    [1, 2, 3, <<"abc">>, [<<"def">>,4], 5, <<"ghi">>],
 2041: 	    [1, 2, 3, <<"abc">>, [<<"def">>,4], 5 | <<"ghi">>]],
 2042: 	    
 2043:     lists:foreach(fun(IoL) ->
 2044: 			  B1 = erlang:iolist_to_binary(IoL),
 2045: 			  B2 = iolist_2_bin(IoL),
 2046: 			  B1 = B2
 2047: 		  end,
 2048: 		  List),
 2049:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),
 2050:     ok.
 2051: 
 2052: %% Test memory managed objects, aka 'resources'
 2053: resource(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2054:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2055:     Type = get_resource_type(0),
 2056:     resource_hugo(Type),
 2057:     resource_otto(Type),
 2058:     resource_new(Type),
 2059:     resource_neg(Type),
 2060:     ok.
 2061: 
 2062: resource_hugo(Type) ->
 2063:     DtorCall = resource_hugo_do(Type),
 2064:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2065:     DtorCall = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2066:     ok.
 2067: 
 2068: resource_hugo_do(Type) ->
 2069:     HugoBin = <<"Hugo Hacker">>,
 2070:     HugoPtr = alloc_resource(Type, HugoBin),
 2071:     Hugo = make_resource(HugoPtr),
 2072:     true = is_reference(Hugo),
 2073:     release_resource(HugoPtr),
 2074:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2075:     {HugoPtr,HugoBin} = get_resource(Type,Hugo),
 2076:     {Pid,_} =
 2077:         spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2078:                               receive {Pid, Type, Resource, Ptr, Bin} ->
 2079:                                       Pid ! {self(), got_it},
 2080:                                       receive {Pid, check_it} ->
 2081:                                               {Ptr,Bin} = get_resource(Type,Resource)
 2082:                                       end
 2083:                               end,
 2084:                               gc_and_exit(ok)
 2085:                       end),
 2086:     Pid ! {self(), Type, Hugo, HugoPtr, HugoBin},
 2087:     {Pid, got_it} = receive_any(),
 2088:     erlang:garbage_collect(),   % just to make our ProcBin move in memory
 2089:     Pid ! {self(), check_it},
 2090:     {'DOWN', _, process, Pid, ok} = receive_any(),
 2091:     [] = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2092:     {HugoPtr,HugoBin} = get_resource(Type,Hugo),
 2093:     {HugoPtr, HugoBin, 1}.
 2094: 
 2095: gc_and_exit(Reason) ->
 2096:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2097:     exit(Reason).
 2098: 
 2099: resource_otto(Type) ->
 2100:     {OttoPtr, OttoBin} = resource_otto_do(Type),
 2101:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2102:     [] = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2103:     release_resource(OttoPtr),
 2104:     {OttoPtr,OttoBin,1} = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2105:     ok.
 2106:     
 2107: resource_otto_do(Type) ->
 2108:     OttoBin = <<"Otto Ordonnans">>,
 2109:     OttoPtr = alloc_resource(Type, OttoBin),
 2110:     Otto = make_resource(OttoPtr),
 2111:     true = is_reference(Otto),
 2112:     %% forget resource term but keep referenced by NIF
 2113:     {OttoPtr, OttoBin}.    
 2114: 
 2115: resource_new(Type) ->
 2116:     {PtrB,BinB} = resource_new_do1(Type),
 2117:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2118:     {PtrB,BinB,1} = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2119:     ok.
 2120:     
 2121: resource_new_do1(Type) ->
 2122:     {{PtrA,BinA}, {ResB,PtrB,BinB}} = resource_new_do2(Type),
 2123:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2124:     {PtrA,BinA,1} = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2125:     {PtrB,BinB} = get_resource(Type, ResB),
 2126:     %% forget ResB and make it garbage
 2127:     {PtrB,BinB}.
 2128:     
 2129: resource_new_do2(Type) ->
 2130:     BinA = <<"NewA">>,
 2131:     BinB = <<"NewB">>,
 2132:     ResA = make_new_resource(Type, BinA),
 2133:     ResB = make_new_resource(Type, BinB),
 2134:     true = is_reference(ResA),
 2135:     true = is_reference(ResB),
 2136:     true = (ResA /= ResB),
 2137:     {PtrA,BinA} = get_resource(Type, ResA),
 2138:     {PtrB,BinB} = get_resource(Type, ResB),
 2139:     true = (PtrA =/= PtrB),
 2140:     %% forget ResA and make it garbage
 2141:     {{PtrA,BinA}, {ResB,PtrB,BinB}}.
 2142: 
 2143: resource_neg(TypeA) ->
 2144:     resource_neg_do(TypeA),
 2145: 
 2146:     catch exit(42), % dummy exception to purge saved stacktraces from earlier exception
 2147:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2148:     {_,_,2} = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2149:     ok.
 2150: 
 2151: resource_neg_do(TypeA) ->
 2152:     TypeB = get_resource_type(1),
 2153:     ResA = make_new_resource(TypeA, <<"Arnold">>),
 2154:     ResB= make_new_resource(TypeB, <<"Bobo">>),
 2155:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch get_resource(TypeA, ResB)),
 2156:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch get_resource(TypeB, ResA)),
 2157: 
 2158:     %% Test init_resource_type fail outside load/upgrade
 2159:     {0, ?RT_CREATE} = init_resource_type("in_vain", ?RT_CREATE),
 2160:     {0, ?RT_TAKEOVER} = init_resource_type("Gold", ?RT_TAKEOVER),
 2161:     {0, ?RT_CREATE bor ?RT_TAKEOVER} =
 2162:         init_resource_type("Gold", ?RT_CREATE bor ?RT_TAKEOVER),
 2163:     ok.
 2164: 
 2165: %% Test enif_make_resource_binary
 2166: resource_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2167:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2168:     {Ptr,Bin} = resource_binary_do(),
 2169:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2170:     Last = last_resource_dtor_call(),
 2171:     ?CHECK({Ptr,Bin,1}, Last),
 2172:     ok.
 2173: 
 2174: resource_binary_do() ->
 2175:     Bin = <<"Hej Hopp i lingonskogen">>,
 2176:     {Ptr,ResBin1} = make_new_resource_binary(Bin),
 2177:     ResBin1 = Bin,          
 2178:     ResInfo = {Ptr,_} = get_resource(binary_resource_type,ResBin1),
 2179: 
 2180:     Papa = self(),
 2181:     {Forwarder,_} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> forwarder(Papa) end),
 2182:     io:format("sending to forwarder pid=~p\n",[Forwarder]),  
 2183:     Forwarder ! ResBin1,
 2184:     ResBin2 = receive_any(),
 2185:     ResBin2 = ResBin1,
 2186:     ResInfo = get_resource(binary_resource_type,ResBin2),
 2187:     Forwarder ! terminate,
 2188:     {'DOWN', _, process, Forwarder, 1} = receive_any(),
 2189:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2190:     ResInfo = get_resource(binary_resource_type,ResBin1),
 2191:     ResInfo = get_resource(binary_resource_type,ResBin2),
 2192:     ResInfo.
 2193: 
 2194: %% Test resource takeover by module upgrade
 2195: resource_takeover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
 2196:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),

 2199:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),

 2500: 				?RT_TAKEOVER},
 2501: 
 2502: 			       {return, 0}  % SUCCESS
 2503: 			      ]),
 2504: 
 2505:     hold_nif_mod_priv_data(nif_mod:get_priv_data_ptr()),
 2506:     [{load,1,1,101},{get_priv_data_ptr,1,2,102}] = nif_mod_call_history(),
 2507: 
 2508:     {NA7,BinNA7} = make_resource(0, Holder, "NA7"),
 2509:     {AN7,_BinAN7} = make_resource(1, Holder, "AN7"),
 2510: 
 2511:     ok = forget_resource(NA7),
 2512:     [{{resource_dtor_A_v1,BinNA7},1,_,_}] = nif_mod_call_history(),
 2513: 
 2514:     ok = forget_resource(AN7),
 2515:     [] = nif_mod_call_history(),
 2516: 
 2517:     true = erlang:delete_module(nif_mod),
 2518:     true = erlang:purge_module(nif_mod),
 2519: 
 2520:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, erlang:system_info(taints)),
 2521:     true = lists:member(nif_mod, erlang:system_info(taints)),
 2522:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),    
 2523:     ok.
 2524: 
 2525: make_resource(Type,Holder,Str) when is_list(Str) ->
 2526:     Bin = list_to_binary(Str),
 2527:     A1 = make_resource_do(Type,Holder,Bin),
 2528:     Bin = read_resource(Type,A1),
 2529:     {A1,Bin}.
 2530: 
 2531: make_resource_do(Type, Holder, Bin) ->
 2532:     Holder ! {self(), make, Type, Bin},
 2533:     {Holder, make_ok, Id} = receive_any(),
 2534:     {Holder,Id}.
 2535: 
 2536: read_resource(Type, {Holder,Id}) ->
 2537:     Holder ! {self(), get, Type, Id},
 2538:     {Holder, get_ok, Bin} = receive_any(),
 2539:     Bin.
 2540: 
 2541: forget_resource({Holder,Id}) ->
 2542:     Holder ! {self(), forget, Id},
 2543:     {Holder, forget_ok, Id} = receive_any(),
 2544:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, aux_work),
 2545:     ok.
 2546: 
 2547: 
 2548: resource_holder() ->
 2549:     resource_holder([]).
 2550: resource_holder(List) ->
 2551:     %%io:format("resource_holder waiting for msg\n", []),
 2552:     Msg = receive_any(),
 2553:     %%io:format("resource_holder got ~p with list = ~p\n", [Msg,List]),
 2554:     case Msg of
 2555: 	{Pid, make, Type, Bin} ->	    
 2556: 	    Resource = nif_mod:make_new_resource(Type, Bin),
 2557: 	    Id = {make_ref(),Bin},
 2558: 	    Pid ! {self(), make_ok, Id},
 2559: 	    resource_holder([{Id,Resource} | List]);
 2560: 	{Pid, get, Type, Id} ->
 2561: 	    {Id,Resource} = lists:keyfind(Id, 1, List),
 2562: 	    Pid ! {self(), get_ok, nif_mod:get_resource(Type, Resource)},
 2563: 	    resource_holder(List);
 2564: 	
 2565: 	{Pid, forget, Id} ->
 2566: 	    NewList = lists:keydelete(Id, 1, List),
 2567: 	    %%io:format("resource_holder forget: NewList = ~p\n", [NewList]),
 2568: 	    resource_holder(Pid, {self(),forget_ok,Id}, NewList)
 2569:     end.
 2570: 
 2571: resource_holder(Pid,Reply,List) ->
 2572:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2573:     %%io:format("resource_holder GC'ed, now send ~p to ~p\n", [Reply,Pid]),
 2574:     Pid ! Reply,
 2575:     resource_holder(List).
 2576: 
 2577: 
 2578: %% Test the threading API functions (reuse tests from driver API)
 2579: threading(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2580:     case erlang:system_info(threads) of
 2581:     	true -> threading_do(Config);
 2582: 	false -> {skipped,"No thread support"}
 2583:     end.
 2584: 
 2585: threading_do(Config) ->
 2586:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2587:     File = filename:join(Data, "tester"),
 2588:     {ok,tester,ModBin} = compile:file(File, [binary,return_errors]),
 2589:     {module,tester} = erlang:load_module(tester,ModBin),
 2590: 
 2591:     ok = tester:load_nif_lib(Config, "basic"),   
 2592:     ok = tester:run(),
 2593: 
 2594:     erlang:load_module(tester,ModBin),
 2595:     erlang:purge_module(tester),
 2596:     ok = tester:load_nif_lib(Config, "rwlock"),
 2597:     ok = tester:run(),
 2598: 
 2599:     erlang:load_module(tester,ModBin),
 2600:     erlang:purge_module(tester),
 2601:     ok = tester:load_nif_lib(Config, "tsd"),
 2602:     ok = tester:run(),
 2603: 
 2604:     erlang:delete_module(tester),
 2605:     erlang:purge_module(tester).
 2606: 
 2607: 
 2608: %% Test NIF message sending
 2609: send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
 2610:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 2611: 
 2612:     N = 1500,
 2613:     List = lists:seq(1,N),
 2614:     {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, self),
 2615:     {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, self()),
 2616:     List = receive_any(),
 2617:     List = receive_any(),
 2618:     Papa = self(),
 2619:     spawn_link(fun() -> {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, Papa) end),
 2620:     List = receive_any(),
 2621: 
 2622:     {ok, 1, BlobS} = send_new_blob(self(), other_term()),
 2623:     BlobR = receive_any(),
 2624:     io:format("Sent ~p\nGot ~p\n", [BlobS, BlobR]),
 2625:     BlobR = BlobS,
 2626: 
 2627:     %% send to dead pid
 2628:     {DeadPid, DeadMon} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> void end),
 2629:     {'DOWN', DeadMon, process, DeadPid, normal} = receive_any(),
 2630:     {ok,0} = send_list_seq(7, DeadPid),
 2631:     ok.
 2632: 
 2633: 
 2634: %% Test tracing of enif_send
 2635: send_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2636:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 2637: 
 2638:     Papa = self(),
 2639:     N = 1500,
 2640:     List = lists:seq(1,N),
 2641: 
 2642:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive get -> Papa ! receive_any(), F() end end),
 2643: 
 2644:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [send,'receive',{tracer,Tracer}]),
 2645:     {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, self()),
 2646:     List = receive_any(),
 2647:     timeout = receive_any(0),
 2648:     Tracer ! get,
 2649:     {trace,Papa,send,List,Papa} = receive_any(),
 2650:     Tracer ! get,
 2651:     {trace,Papa,'receive',List} = receive_any().
 2652: 
 2653: %% Test that seq_trace works with nif trace
 2654: send_seq_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2655:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 2656: 
 2657:     Papa = self(),
 2658:     N = 1500,
 2659:     List = lists:seq(1,N),
 2660:     Label = make_ref(),
 2661: 
 2662:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive get -> Papa ! receive_any(), F() end end),
 2663: 
 2664:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Tracer),
 2665:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
 2666:     seq_trace:set_token(send,true),
 2667:     seq_trace:set_token('receive',true),
 2668: 
 2669:     {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, self()),
 2670:     List = receive_any(),
 2671:     timeout = receive_any(0),
 2672:     {ok,1} = send_list_seq(N, self()),
 2673:     List = receive_any(),
 2674:     timeout = receive_any(0),
 2675: 
 2676:     Tracer ! get,
 2677:     {seq_trace,Label,{send,{0,1},Papa,Papa,List}} = receive_any(),
 2678:     Tracer ! get,
 2679:     {seq_trace,Label,{'receive',{0,1},Papa,Papa,List}} = receive_any(),
 2680:     Tracer ! get,
 2681:     {seq_trace,Label,{send,{1,2},Papa,Papa,List}} = receive_any(),
 2682:     Tracer ! get,
 2683:     {seq_trace,Label,{'receive',{1,2},Papa,Papa,List}} = receive_any().
 2684: 
 2685: 
 2686: %% More NIF message sending
 2687: send2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2688:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 2689: 
 2690:     send2_do1(fun send_blob_dbg/2),
 2691:     ok.
 2692: 
 2693: %% Send msg from user thread
 2694: send_threaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2695:     send2_do1(fun(ME,To) -> send_blob_thread_dbg(ME,To,join) end),
 2696:     send2_do1(fun(ME,To) -> send_blob_thread_and_join(ME,To) end),
 2697:     ok.
 2698: 
 2699: 
 2700: send2_do1(SendBlobF) ->
 2701:     io:format("sending to self=~p\n",[self()]),
 2702:     send2_do2(SendBlobF, self()),
 2703: 
 2704:     Papa = self(),
 2705:     {Forwarder,_} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> forwarder(Papa) end),
 2706:     io:format("sending to forwarder pid=~p\n",[Forwarder]),
 2707:     send2_do2(SendBlobF, Forwarder),
 2708:     Forwarder ! terminate,
 2709:     {'DOWN', _, process, Forwarder, 4} = receive_any(),
 2710:     ok.
 2711: 
 2712: send2_do2(SendBlobF, To) ->   
 2713:     MsgEnv = alloc_msgenv(),
 2714:     repeat(50, fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term()) end, []),
 2715:     {ok,1,Blob0} = SendBlobF(MsgEnv, To),
 2716:     Blob1 = receive_any(),
 2717:     Blob1 = Blob0,
 2718:     
 2719:     clear_msgenv(MsgEnv),
 2720:     repeat(50, fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term()) end, []),
 2721:     {ok,1,Blob2} = SendBlobF(MsgEnv, To),
 2722:     Blob3 = receive_any(),
 2723:     Blob3 = Blob2,
 2724: 
 2725:     clear_msgenv(MsgEnv),
 2726:     repeat(50, fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term()) end, []),
 2727: 
 2728:     clear_msgenv(MsgEnv),
 2729:     repeat(50, fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term()) end, []),
 2730:     {ok,1,Blob4} = SendBlobF(MsgEnv, To),
 2731:     Blob5 = receive_any(),
 2732:     Blob5 = Blob4,
 2733: 
 2734:     clear_msgenv(MsgEnv),
 2735:     clear_msgenv(MsgEnv),
 2736:     repeat(50, fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term()) end, []),
 2737:     {ok,1,Blob6} = SendBlobF(MsgEnv, To),
 2738:     Blob7 = receive_any(),
 2739:     Blob7 = Blob6,
 2740: 
 2741:     ok.
 2742: 
 2743: 
 2744: send_blob_thread_and_join(MsgEnv, To) ->
 2745:     {ok,Blob} = send_blob_thread_dbg(MsgEnv, To, no_join),
 2746:     {ok,SendRes} = join_send_thread(MsgEnv),
 2747:     {ok,SendRes,Blob}.
 2748: 
 2749: send_blob_dbg(MsgEnv, To) ->
 2750:     Ret = send_blob(MsgEnv, To),
 2751:     %%io:format("send_blob to ~p returned ~p\n",[To,Ret]),
 2752:     Ret.
 2753: 
 2754: send_blob_thread_dbg(MsgEnv, To, Join) ->
 2755:     Ret = send_blob_thread(MsgEnv, To, Join),
 2756:     %%io:format("send_blob_thread to ~p Join=~p returned ~p\n",[To,Join,Ret]),
 2757:     Ret.
 2758: 
 2759: 
 2760: forwarder(To) ->
 2761:     forwarder(To, 0).
 2762: forwarder(To, N) ->
 2763:     case receive_any() of
 2764: 	terminate ->
 2765:             gc_and_exit(N);
 2766: 	Msg ->	    
 2767: 	    To ! Msg,	   
 2768: 	    forwarder(To, N+1)
 2769:     end.
 2770: 
 2771: other_term() ->
 2772:     {fun(X,Y) -> X*Y end, make_ref()}.
 2773: 
 2774: %% Message sending stress test
 2775: send3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2776:     %% Let a number of processes send random message blobs between each other
 2777:     %% using enif_send. Kill and spawn new ones randomly to keep a ~constant
 2778:     %% number of workers running.
 2779:     rand:seed(exsplus),
 2780:     io:format("seed: ~p\n",[rand:export_seed()]),
 2781:     ets:new(nif_SUITE,[named_table,public]),
 2782:     true = ets:insert(nif_SUITE,{send3,0,0,0,0}),
 2783:     timer:send_after(10000, timeout), % Run for 10 seconds
 2784:     SpawnCnt = send3_controller(0, [], [], 20),
 2785:     [{_,Rcv,SndOk,SndFail,Balance}] = ets:lookup(nif_SUITE,send3),
 2786:     io:format("spawns=~p received=~p, sent=~p send-failure=~p balance=~p\n",
 2787:               [SpawnCnt,Rcv,SndOk,SndFail,Balance]),
 2788:     ets:delete(nif_SUITE).
 2789: 
 2790: send3_controller(SpawnCnt, [], _, infinity) ->
 2791:     SpawnCnt;
 2792: send3_controller(SpawnCnt0, Mons0, Pids0, Tick) ->
 2793:     receive 
 2794:         timeout ->
 2795:             io:format("Timeout. Sending 'halt' to ~p\n",[Pids0]),            
 2796:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! {halt,self()} end, Pids0),
 2797:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> receive {halted,P} -> ok end end, Pids0),
 2798:             QTot = lists:foldl(fun(P,QSum) ->
 2799:                                  {message_queue_len,QLen} = 
 2800:                                     erlang:process_info(P,message_queue_len),
 2801:                                  QSum + QLen
 2802:                                end, 0, Pids0),
 2803:             io:format("Total queue length ~p\n",[QTot]),            
 2804:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Pids0),
 2805:             send3_controller(SpawnCnt0, Mons0, [], infinity);
 2806:         {'DOWN', MonRef, process, _Pid, _} ->
 2807:             Mons1 = lists:delete(MonRef, Mons0),
 2808:             %%io:format("Got DOWN from ~p. Monitors left: ~p\n",[Pid,Mons1]),            
 2809:             send3_controller(SpawnCnt0, Mons1, Pids0, Tick)
 2810:     after Tick -> 
 2811:         Max = 20,
 2812:         N = length(Pids0),
 2813:         PidN = rand:uniform(Max),
 2814:         %%io:format("N=~p PidN=~p Pids0=~p\n", [N,PidN,Pids0]), 
 2815:         case PidN > N of
 2816:             true ->
 2817:                 {NewPid,Mon} = spawn_opt(fun send3_proc/0, [link,monitor]),                
 2818:                 lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! {is_born,NewPid} end, Pids0),
 2819:                 Balance = ets:lookup_element(nif_SUITE,send3,5),
 2820:                 Inject = (Balance =< 0),
 2821:                 case Inject of
 2822:                     true ->  ok;
 2823:                     false -> ets:update_element(nif_SUITE,send3,{5,-1})
 2824:                 end,
 2825:                 NewPid ! {pids,Pids0,Inject},
 2826:                 send3_controller(SpawnCnt0+1, [Mon|Mons0], [NewPid|Pids0], Tick);
 2827:             false ->
 2828:                 KillPid = lists:nth(PidN,Pids0),
 2829:                 KillPid ! die,
 2830:                 Pids1 = lists:delete(KillPid, Pids0),
 2831:                 lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! {is_dead,KillPid} end, Pids1),
 2832:                 send3_controller(SpawnCnt0, Mons0, Pids1, Tick)
 2833:         end        
 2834:    end.
 2835: 
 2836: send3_proc() ->
 2837:     %%io:format("Process ~p spawned\n",[self()]),
 2838:     send3_proc([self()], {0,0,0}, {1,2,3,4,5}).
 2839: send3_proc(Pids0, Counters={Rcv,SndOk,SndFail}, State0) ->
 2840:     %%io:format("~p: Pids0=~p", [self(), Pids0]),
 2841:     %%timer:sleep(10),
 2842:     receive 
 2843:         {pids, Pids1, Inject} ->
 2844:             %%io:format("~p: got ~p Inject=~p\n", [self(), Pids1, Inject]), 
 2845:             Pids0 = [self()],
 2846:             Pids2 = [self() | Pids1],
 2847:             case Inject of
 2848:                 true -> send3_proc_send(Pids2, Counters, State0);
 2849:                 false -> send3_proc(Pids2, Counters, State0)
 2850:             end;
 2851:         {is_born, Pid} ->
 2852:             %%io:format("~p: is_born ~p, got ~p\n", [self(), Pid, Pids0]), 
 2853:             send3_proc([Pid | Pids0], Counters, State0);
 2854:         {is_dead, Pid} ->            
 2855:             Pids1 = lists:delete(Pid,Pids0),
 2856:             %%io:format("~p: is_dead ~p, got ~p\n", [self(), Pid, Pids1]),
 2857:             send3_proc(Pids1, Counters, State0);
 2858:         {blob, Blob0} ->
 2859:             %%io:format("~p: blob ~p\n", [self(), Blob0]),
 2860:             State1 = send3_new_state(State0, Blob0),
 2861:             send3_proc_send(Pids0, {Rcv+1,SndOk,SndFail}, State1);
 2862:         die ->
 2863:             %%io:format("Process ~p terminating, stats = ~p\n",[self(),Counters]),
 2864:             {message_queue_len,Dropped} = erlang:process_info(self(),message_queue_len),
 2865:             _R = ets:update_counter(nif_SUITE,send3,
 2866:                                [{2,Rcv},{3,SndOk},{4,SndFail},{5,1-Dropped}]),
 2867:             %%io:format("~p: dies R=~p\n", [self(), R]),
 2868:             ok;
 2869:         {halt,Papa} ->
 2870:             Papa ! {halted,self()},
 2871:             io:format("~p halted\n",[self()]),
 2872:             receive die -> ok end,
 2873:             io:format("~p dying\n",[self()])
 2874:     end.
 2875: 
 2876: send3_proc_send(Pids, {Rcv,SndOk,SndFail}, State0) ->
 2877:     To = lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Pids)),Pids),
 2878:     Blob = send3_make_blob(),
 2879:     State1 = send3_new_state(State0,Blob), 
 2880:     case send3_send(To, Blob) of
 2881:         true ->
 2882:             send3_proc(Pids, {Rcv,SndOk+1,SndFail}, State1);
 2883:         false ->
 2884:             send3_proc(Pids, {Rcv,SndOk,SndFail+1}, State1)
 2885:     end.
 2886: 
 2887: 
 2888: send3_make_blob() ->    
 2889:     case rand:uniform(20)-1 of
 2890:         0 -> {term,[]};
 2891:         N ->
 2892:             MsgEnv = alloc_msgenv(), 
 2893:             repeat(N bsr 1,
 2894:                    fun(_) -> grow_blob(MsgEnv,other_term(),rand:uniform(1 bsl 20))
 2895:                    end, void),
 2896:             case (N band 3) of
 2897:                 0 -> {term,copy_blob(MsgEnv)};
 2898:                 1 -> {copy,copy_blob(MsgEnv)};
 2899:                 _ -> {msgenv,MsgEnv}
 2900:             end
 2901:     end.
 2902: 
 2903: send3_send(Pid, Msg) ->
 2904:     %% 90% enif_send and 10% normal bang
 2905:     case rand:uniform(10) of
 2906:         1 -> send3_send_bang(Pid,Msg);
 2907:         _ -> send3_send_nif(Pid,Msg)
 2908:     end.
 2909: send3_send_nif(Pid, {term,Blob}) ->
 2910:     %%io:format("~p send term nif\n",[self()]),
 2911:     send_term(Pid, {blob, Blob}) =:= 1;
 2912: send3_send_nif(Pid, {copy,Blob}) ->
 2913:     %%io:format("~p send term nif\n",[self()]),
 2914:     send_copy_term(Pid, {blob, Blob}) =:= 1;
 2915: send3_send_nif(Pid, {msgenv,MsgEnv}) ->
 2916:     %%io:format("~p send blob nif\n",[self()]),   
 2917:     send3_blob(MsgEnv, Pid, blob) =:= 1.
 2918: 
 2919: send3_send_bang(Pid, {term,Blob}) ->
 2920:     %%io:format("~p send term bang\n",[self()]),   
 2921:     Pid ! {blob, Blob},
 2922:     true;
 2923: send3_send_bang(Pid, {copy,Blob}) ->
 2924:     %%io:format("~p send term bang\n",[self()]),
 2925:     Pid ! {blob, Blob},
 2926:     true;
 2927: send3_send_bang(Pid, {msgenv,MsgEnv}) ->
 2928:     %%io:format("~p send blob bang\n",[self()]),   
 2929:     Pid ! {blob, copy_blob(MsgEnv)},
 2930:     true.
 2931: 
 2932: send3_new_state(State, Blob) ->
 2933:     case rand:uniform(5+2) of
 2934:         N when N =< 5-> setelement(N, State, Blob);
 2935:         _ -> State  % Don't store blob
 2936:     end.
 2937: 
 2938: %% Negative testing of load_nif
 2939: neg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2940:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),
 2941:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch erlang:load_nif(badarg, 0)),
 2942:     
 2943:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2944:     File = filename:join(Data, "nif_mod"),
 2945:     {ok,nif_mod,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary,return_errors]),
 2946:     {module,nif_mod} = erlang:load_module(nif_mod,Bin),
 2947: 
 2948:     {error,{load_failed,"Failed to load NIF library"++_}} = nif_mod:load_nif_lib(Config, 0),
 2949:     {error,{bad_lib,"Failed to find library init"++_}} = nif_mod:load_nif_lib(Config, 3),
 2950:     {error,{bad_lib,"Function not found"++_}} = nif_mod:load_nif_lib(Config, 4),
 2951:     {error,{bad_lib,"Duplicate NIF entry for"++_}} = nif_mod:load_nif_lib(Config, 5),
 2952:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),
 2953:     ok.
 2954: 
 2955: %% Test all enif_is functions
 2956: is_checks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

 2959: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2960: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 12),
 2961:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2962: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2963: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -12),
 2964:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2965: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2966: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 18446744073709551617),
 2967:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2968: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2969: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -18446744073709551617),
 2970:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2971: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2972: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 99.146),
 2973:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2974: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2975: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -99.146),
 2976:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2977: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2978: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, 18446744073709551616.2e2),
 2979:     ok = check_is(hejsan, <<19,98>>, make_ref(), ok, fun() -> ok end,
 2980: 			self(), hd(erlang:ports()), [], [1,9,9,8],
 2981: 			{hejsan, "hejsan", [$h,"ejs",<<"an">>]}, -18446744073709551616.2e2),
 2982:     try
 2983:         check_is_exception(),
 2984:         throw(expected_badarg)
 2985:     catch
 2986:         error:badarg ->
 2987:             ok
 2988:     end.
 2989: 
 2990: %% Test all enif_get_length functions
 2991: get_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2992:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 2993:     ok = length_test(hejsan, "hejsan", [], [], not_a_list, [1,2|3]).
 2994: 
 2995: ensure_lib_loaded(Config) ->
 2996:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1).
 2997: ensure_lib_loaded(Config, Ver) ->
 2998:     Path = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 2999:     case lib_version() of
 3000:         undefined ->
 3001:             Lib = "nif_SUITE." ++ integer_to_list(Ver),
 3002:             ok = erlang:load_nif(filename:join(Path,Lib), []);
 3003:         Ver when is_integer(Ver) ->
 3004:             ok
 3005:     end,
 3006:     erl_ddll:try_load(Path, echo_drv, []),
 3007:     ok.
 3008: 
 3009: make_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3010:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3011:     An0Atom = an0atom,
 3012:     An0Atom0 = 'an\000atom\000',
 3013:     Atoms = make_atoms(),
 3014:     7 = size(Atoms),
 3015:     Atoms = {An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom0,An0Atom,An0Atom,An0Atom0}.
 3016: 
 3017: make_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3018:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3019:     Strings = make_strings(),
 3020:     5 = size(Strings),
 3021:     A0String = "a0string",
 3022:     A0String0 = [$a,0,$s,$t,$r,$i,$n,$g,0],
 3023:     AStringWithAccents = [$E,$r,$l,$a,$n,$g,$ ,16#e4,$r,$ ,$e,$t,$t,$ ,$g,$e,$n,$e,$r,$e,$l,$l,$t,$ ,$p,$r,$o,$g,$r,$a,$m,$s,$p,$r,16#e5,$k],
 3024:     Strings = {A0String,A0String,A0String,A0String0, AStringWithAccents}.
 3025: 
 3026: reverse_list_test(Config) ->
 3027:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3028:     List = lists:seq(1,100),
 3029:     RevList = lists:reverse(List),
 3030:     RevList = reverse_list(List),
 3031:     badarg = reverse_list(foo).
 3032: 
 3033: %% Memory leak of tmp-buffer when inspecting iolist or unaligned binary in unbound environment
 3034: otp_9668(Config) ->
 3035:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3036:     TmpMem = tmpmem(),
 3037:     IOList = ["This",' ',<<"is">>,' ',[<<"an iolist">>,'.']],    
 3038:     otp_9668_nif(IOList),
 3039: 
 3040:     <<_:5/bitstring,UnalignedBin:10/binary,_/bitstring>> = <<"Abuse me as unaligned">>,
 3041:     otp_9668_nif(UnalignedBin),
 3042: 
 3043:     verify_tmpmem(TmpMem),
 3044:     ok.
 3045: 
 3046: %% Copy of writable binary
 3047: otp_9828(Config) ->
 3048:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config, 1),
 3049:     otp_9828_loop(<<"I'm alive!">>, 1000).
 3050: 
 3051: otp_9828_loop(_Bin, 0) ->
 3052:     ok;
 3053: otp_9828_loop(Bin, Val) ->
 3054:     WrtBin = <<Bin/binary, Val:32>>,
 3055:     ok = otp_9828_nif(WrtBin),
 3056:     otp_9828_loop(WrtBin, Val-1).
 3057: 
 3058: 
 3059: consume_timeslice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3060:     case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 3061: 	  erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 3062: 	{false, false} ->
 3063: 	    consume_timeslice_test(Config);
 3064: 	{false, true} ->
 3065: 	    {skipped, "Lock checking enabled"};
 3066: 	_ ->
 3067: 	    {skipped, "Debug compiled"}
 3068:     end.
 3069: 
 3070: consume_timeslice_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3071:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3072:     CONTEXT_REDS = 4000,
 3073:     Me = self(),
 3074:     Go = make_ref(),
 3075:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 3076:     Done = make_ref(),
 3077:     DummyMFA = {?MODULE,dummy_call,1},
 3078:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 3079:                       receive Go -> ok end,
 3080:                       {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 3081:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(100, false),
 3082:                       dummy_call(111),
 3083:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(90, false),
 3084:                       dummy_call(222),
 3085:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(10, false),
 3086:                       dummy_call(333),
 3087:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3088:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3089:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3090:                       1 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3091:                       0 = consume_timeslice_nif(25, false),
 3092: 
 3093:                       ok = case consume_timeslice_nif(1, true) of
 3094:                                Cnt when Cnt > 70, Cnt < 80 -> ok;
 3095:                                Other -> Other
 3096:                            end,
 3097:                       dummy_call(444),
 3098: 
 3099:                       {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 3100:                       Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 3101:                       exit(Done)
 3102:               end),
 3103:     erlang:yield(),
 3104: 
 3105:     erlang:trace_pattern(DummyMFA, [{'_', [], [{return_trace}]}], [local]),
 3106:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [call, running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 3107: 
 3108:     P ! Go,
 3109: 
 3110:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 3111:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3112: 
 3113:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(100),
 3114:     %% dummy_call(111)
 3115:     %%
 3116:     %% Note that we may be scheduled out immediately before or immediately
 3117:     %% "after" dummy_call(111) depending on when the emulator tests reductions.
 3118:     %%
 3119:     %% In either case, we should be rescheduled before the function returns.
 3120:     Dummy_111 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[111]},
 3121:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3122:         {trace, P, out, _} ->
 3123:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3124:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3125:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_111} = next_tmsg(P);
 3126:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_111} ->
 3127:             {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3128:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P)
 3129:     end,
 3130:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3131: 
 3132:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(90),
 3133:     %% dummy_call(222)
 3134:     Dummy_222 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[222]},
 3135:     {trace, P, call, Dummy_222} = next_tmsg(P),
 3136:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3137: 
 3138:     %% consume_timeslice_nif(10),
 3139:     %% dummy_call(333)
 3140:     Dummy_333 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[333]},
 3141:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3142:         {trace, P, out, _} ->
 3143:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3144:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3145:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_333} = next_tmsg(P);
 3146:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_333} ->
 3147:             {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 3148:             {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P)
 3149:     end,
 3150:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3151: 
 3152:     %% 25,25,25,25, 25
 3153:     {trace, P, out, {?MODULE,consume_timeslice_nif,2}} = next_tmsg(P),
 3154:     {trace, P, in, {?MODULE,consume_timeslice_nif,2}} = next_tmsg(P),
 3155: 
 3156:     %% consume_timeslice(1,true)
 3157:     %% dummy_call(444)
 3158:     Dummy_444 = {?MODULE,dummy_call,[444]},
 3159:     case next_tmsg(P) of
 3160:         {trace, P, out, DummyMFA} ->
 3161:             %% See dummy_call(111) above
 3162:             {trace, P, in, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P),
 3163:             {trace, P, call, Dummy_444} = next_tmsg(P);
 3164:         {trace, P, call, Dummy_444} ->
 3165:             {trace, P, out, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P),
 3166:             {trace, P, in, DummyMFA} = next_tmsg(P)
 3167:     end,
 3168:     {trace, P, return_from, DummyMFA, ok} = next_tmsg(P),
 3169: 
 3170:     %% exit(Done)
 3171:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 3172: 
 3173:     ExpReds = (100 + 90 + 10 + 25*5 + 75) * CONTEXT_REDS div 100,
 3174:     receive
 3175: 	{RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < (ExpReds + 10), Reductions > (ExpReds - 10) ->
 3176: 	    io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 3177: 	    ok;
 3178: 	{RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 3179: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions, ExpReds})
 3180:     end,
 3181:     
 3182:     none = next_msg(P),
 3183: 
 3184:     ok.
 3185: 
 3186: nif_schedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3187:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3188:     A = "this is a string",
 3189:     B = {this,is,a,tuple},
 3190:     {B,A} = call_nif_schedule(A, B),
 3191:     ok = try call_nif_schedule(1, 2)
 3192: 	 catch
 3193: 	     error:badarg:Stk ->
 3194: 		 [{?MODULE,call_nif_schedule,[1,2],_}|_] = Stk,
 3195: 		 ok
 3196: 	 end,
 3197:     ok.
 3198: 
 3199: nif_exception(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3200:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3201:     try
 3202: 	%% this checks that the expected exception occurs when the NIF
 3203: 	%% calls enif_make_badarg at some point but then tries to return a
 3204: 	%% value that isn't an exception
 3205: 	call_nif_exception(0),
 3206: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3207:     catch
 3208: 	error:badarg ->
 3209: 	    ok
 3210:     end,
 3211:     %% this checks that a NIF can raise various terms as exceptions
 3212:     ok = nif_raise_exceptions(call_nif_exception),
 3213:     ok.
 3214: 
 3215: nif_nan_and_inf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3216:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3217:     try
 3218: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(nan),
 3219: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3220:     catch
 3221: 	error:badarg ->
 3222: 	    ok
 3223:     end,
 3224:     try
 3225: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(inf),
 3226: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3227:     catch
 3228: 	error:badarg ->
 3229: 	    ok
 3230:     end,
 3231:     try
 3232: 	call_nif_nan_or_inf(tuple),
 3233: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3234:     catch
 3235: 	error:badarg ->
 3236: 	    ok
 3237:     end.
 3238: 
 3239: nif_atom_too_long(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3240:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3241:     try
 3242: 	call_nif_atom_too_long(all),
 3243: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3244:     catch
 3245: 	error:badarg ->
 3246: 	    ok
 3247:     end,
 3248:     try
 3249: 	call_nif_atom_too_long(len),
 3250: 	ct:fail(expected_badarg)
 3251:     catch
 3252: 	error:badarg ->
 3253: 	    ok
 3254:     end.
 3255: 
 3256: next_msg(_Pid) ->
 3257:     receive
 3258:         M -> M
 3259:     after 100 ->
 3260:               none
 3261:     end.
 3262: 
 3263: next_tmsg(Pid) ->    
 3264:     receive TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 3265:                       element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 3266:                       element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 3267:                 TMsg
 3268:     after 100 ->
 3269:               none
 3270:     end.
 3271: 
 3272: dummy_call(_) ->    
 3273:     ok.
 3274: 
 3275: tmpmem() ->
 3276:     erts_debug:alloc_blocks_size(temp_alloc).
 3277: 
 3278: verify_tmpmem(MemInfo) ->
 3279:     %%wait_for_test_procs(),
 3280:     case tmpmem() of
 3281: 	MemInfo ->
 3282: 	    io:format("Tmp mem info: ~p", [MemInfo]),
 3283: 	    case MemInfo of
 3284: 		{notsup,undefined} ->
 3285: 		    %% Use 'erl +Mea max' to do more complete memory leak testing.
 3286: 		    {comment,"Incomplete or no mem leak testing"};
 3287: 		_ ->
 3288: 		    ok
 3289: 	    end;
 3290: 	Other ->
 3291:             ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p", [MemInfo, Other])
 3292:     end.
 3293: 
 3294: call(Pid,Cmd) ->
 3295:     %%io:format("~p calling ~p with ~p\n",[self(), Pid, Cmd]),
 3296:     Pid ! {self(), Cmd},
 3297:     receive
 3298: 	{Pid,Reply} -> Reply
 3299:     end.
 3300: 
 3301: receive_any() ->
 3302:     receive M -> M end.	     
 3303: 
 3304: receive_any(Timeout) ->
 3305:     receive M -> M
 3306:     after Timeout -> timeout end.
 3307: 
 3308: flush() ->
 3309:     flush(1).
 3310: 
 3311: flush(0) ->
 3312:     flush(0, 10);  % don't waste too much time waiting for nothing
 3313: flush(N) ->
 3314:     flush(N, 1000).
 3315: 
 3316: flush(N, Timeout) ->
 3317:     receive M ->
 3318:             [M | flush(N-1)]
 3319:     after Timeout ->
 3320:             []
 3321:     end.
 3322: 
 3323: repeat(0, _, Arg) ->
 3324:     Arg;
 3325: repeat(N, Fun, Arg0) ->
 3326:     repeat(N-1, Fun, Fun(Arg0)).
 3327: 
 3328: repeat_while(Fun, Acc0) ->
 3329:     case Fun(Acc0) of
 3330:         false -> ok;
 3331:         Acc1 ->
 3332:             repeat_while(Fun, Acc1)
 3333:     end.
 3334: 
 3335: check(Exp,Got,Line) ->
 3336:     case Got of
 3337:  	Exp -> Exp;	    
 3338:   	_ ->
 3339: 	    io:format("CHECK at line ~p\nExpected: ~p\nGot     : ~p\n",
 3340:                       [Line,Exp,Got]),
 3341:  	    Got
 3342:     end.
 3343: 
 3344: nif_raise_exceptions(NifFunc) ->
 3345:     ExcTerms = [{error, test}, "a string", <<"a binary">>,
 3346:                 42, [1,2,3,4,5], [{p,1},{p,2},{p,3}]],
 3347:     lists:foldl(fun(Term, ok) ->
 3348:                         try
 3349:                             erlang:apply(?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term]),
 3350:                             ct:fail({expected,Term})
 3351:                         catch
 3352:                             error:Term:Stk ->
 3353:                                 [{?MODULE,NifFunc,[Term],_}|_] = Stk,
 3354:                                 ok
 3355:                         end
 3356:                 end, ok, ExcTerms).
 3357: 
 3358: -define(ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR, -9223372036854775808).
 3359: -define(TIME_UNITS, [second, millisecond, microsecond, nanosecond]).
 3360: 
 3361: nif_monotonic_time(_Config) ->
 3362:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = monotonic_time(invalid_time_unit),
 3363:     mtime_loop(1000000).
 3364: 
 3365: mtime_loop(0) ->
 3366:     ok;
 3367: mtime_loop(N) ->
 3368:     chk_mtime(?TIME_UNITS),
 3369:     mtime_loop(N-1).
 3370: 
 3371: chk_mtime([]) ->
 3372:     ok;
 3373: chk_mtime([TU|TUs]) ->
 3374:     A = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3375:     B = monotonic_time(TU),
 3376:     C = erlang:monotonic_time(TU),
 3377:     try
 3378: 	true = A =< B,
 3379: 	true = B =< C
 3380:     catch
 3381: 	_ : _ ->
 3382: 	    ct:fail({monotonic_time_missmatch, TU, A, B, C})
 3383:     end,
 3384:     chk_mtime(TUs).
 3385: 
 3386: nif_time_offset(_Config) ->
 3387:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = time_offset(invalid_time_unit),
 3388:     toffs_loop(1000000).
 3389: 
 3390: toffs_loop(0) ->
 3391:     ok;
 3392: toffs_loop(N) ->
 3393:     chk_toffs(?TIME_UNITS),
 3394:     toffs_loop(N-1).
 3395: 
 3396: chk_toffs([]) ->
 3397:     ok;
 3398: chk_toffs([TU|TUs]) ->
 3399:     TO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3400:     NifTO = time_offset(TU),
 3401:     case TO =:= NifTO of
 3402:         true ->
 3403:             ok;
 3404:         false ->
 3405:             case erlang:system_info(time_warp_mode) of
 3406:                 no_time_warp ->
 3407:                     ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO});
 3408:                 _ ->
 3409:                     %% Most frequent time offset change
 3410:                     %% is currently only every 15:th
 3411:                     %% second so this should currently
 3412:                     %% work...
 3413:                     NTO = erlang:time_offset(TU),
 3414:                     case NifTO =:= NTO of
 3415:                         true ->
 3416:                             ok;
 3417:                         false ->
 3418:                             ct:fail({time_offset_mismatch, TU, TO, NifTO, NTO})
 3419:                     end
 3420:             end
 3421:     end,
 3422:     chk_toffs(TUs).
 3423: 
 3424: nif_convert_time_unit(_Config) ->
 3425:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, second, invalid_time_unit),
 3426:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, second),
 3427:     ?ERL_NIF_TIME_ERROR = convert_time_unit(0, invalid_time_unit, invalid_time_unit),
 3428:     lists:foreach(fun (Offset) ->
 3429:                           lists:foreach(fun (Diff) ->
 3430:                                                 chk_ctu(Diff+(Offset*1000*1000*1000))
 3431:                                         end,
 3432:                                         [999999999999,
 3433:                                          99999999999,
 3434:                                          9999999999,
 3435:                                          999999999,
 3436:                                          99999999,
 3437:                                          9999999,
 3438:                                          999999,
 3439:                                          99999,
 3440:                                          999,
 3441:                                          99,
 3442:                                          9,
 3443:                                          1,
 3444:                                          11,
 3445:                                          101,
 3446:                                          1001,
 3447:                                          10001,
 3448:                                          100001,
 3449:                                          1000001,
 3450:                                          10000001,
 3451:                                          100000001,
 3452:                                          1000000001,
 3453:                                          100000000001,
 3454:                                          1000000000001,
 3455:                                          5,
 3456:                                          50,
 3457:                                          500,
 3458:                                          5000,
 3459:                                          50000,
 3460:                                          500000,
 3461:                                          5000000,
 3462:                                          50000000,
 3463:                                          500000000,
 3464:                                          5000000000,
 3465:                                          50000000000,
 3466:                                          500000000000])
 3467:                   end,
 3468:                   [-4711, -1000, -475, -5, -4, -3, -2, -1, 0,
 3469:                    1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 475, 1000, 4711]),
 3470:     ctu_loop(1000000).
 3471: 
 3472: ctu_loop(0) ->
 3473:     ok;
 3474: ctu_loop(N) ->
 3475:     chk_ctu(erlang:monotonic_time(nanosecond)),
 3476:     ctu_loop(N-1).
 3477: 
 3478: chk_ctu(Time) ->
 3479:     chk_ctu(Time, ?TIME_UNITS).
 3480: 
 3481: chk_ctu(_Time, []) ->
 3482:     ok;
 3483: chk_ctu(Time, [FromTU|FromTUs]) ->
 3484:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ?TIME_UNITS),
 3485:     chk_ctu(Time, FromTUs).
 3486: 
 3487: chk_ctu(_Time, _FromTU, []) ->
 3488:     ok;
 3489: chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, [ToTU|ToTUs]) ->
 3490:     T = erlang:convert_time_unit(Time, nanosecond, FromTU),
 3491:     TE = erlang:convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3492:     TN = convert_time_unit(T, FromTU, ToTU),
 3493:     case TE =:= TN of
 3494: 	false ->
 3495: 	    ct:fail({conversion_mismatch, FromTU, T, ToTU, TE, TN});
 3496: 	true ->
 3497: 	    chk_ctu(Time, FromTU, ToTUs)
 3498:     end.
 3499: 
 3500: nif_now_time(Config) ->
 3501:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3502: 
 3503:     N1 = now(),
 3504:     NifN1 = now_time(),
 3505:     NifN2 = now_time(),
 3506:     N2 = now(),
 3507:     true = N1 < NifN1,
 3508:     true = NifN1 < NifN2,
 3509:     true = NifN2 < N2.
 3510: 
 3511: nif_cpu_time(Config) ->
 3512:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3513: 
 3514:     try cpu_time() of
 3515:         {_, _, _} ->
 3516:             ok
 3517:     catch error:badarg ->
 3518:             {comment, "cpu_time not supported"}
 3519:     end.
 3520: 
 3521: nif_unique_integer(Config) ->
 3522:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3523: 
 3524:     UM1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3525:     UM2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic]),
 3526:     UM3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
 3527: 
 3528:     true = UM1 < UM2,
 3529:     true = UM2 < UM3,
 3530: 
 3531:     UMP1 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3532:     UMP2 = unique_integer_nif([monotonic, positive]),
 3533:     UMP3 = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic, positive]),
 3534: 
 3535:     true = 0 =< UMP1,
 3536:     true = UMP1 < UMP2,
 3537:     true = UMP2 < UMP3,
 3538: 
 3539:     UP1 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3540:     UP2 = unique_integer_nif([positive]),
 3541:     UP3 = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
 3542: 
 3543:     true = 0 =< UP1,
 3544:     true = 0 =< UP2,
 3545:     true = 0 =< UP3,
 3546: 
 3547:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3548:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])),
 3549:     true = is_integer(unique_integer_nif([])).
 3550: 
 3551: nif_is_process_alive(Config) ->
 3552:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3553: 
 3554:     {Pid,_} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> receive ok -> nok end end),
 3555:     true = is_process_alive_nif(Pid),
 3556:     exit(Pid, die),
 3557:     receive _ -> ok end, %% Clear monitor
 3558:     false = is_process_alive_nif(Pid).
 3559: 
 3560: nif_is_port_alive(Config) ->
 3561:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3562: 
 3563:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3564:     true = is_port_alive_nif(Port),
 3565:     port_close(Port),
 3566:     false = is_port_alive_nif(Port).
 3567: 
 3568: nif_term_to_binary(Config) ->
 3569:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3570:     T = {#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3571:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3572:     ct:log("~p",[Bin]),
 3573:     Bin = term_to_binary_nif(T, undefined),
 3574:     true = term_to_binary_nif(T, self()),
 3575:     receive Bin -> ok end.
 3576: 
 3577: -define(ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE, 16#20000000).
 3578: 
 3579: nif_binary_to_term(Config) ->
 3580:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3581:     BigMap = maps:from_list([{I,-I} || I <- lists:seq(1,100)]),
 3582:     [nif_binary_to_term_do(T)
 3583:      || T <- [{#{ok => nok}, <<0:8096>>, lists:seq(1,100)},
 3584:               atom, 42, self(), BigMap]],
 3585:     ok.
 3586: 
 3587: nif_binary_to_term_do(T) ->
 3588:     Dummy = [true|false],
 3589:     Bin = term_to_binary(T),
 3590:     Len = byte_size(Bin),
 3591:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 0),
 3592:     Len = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, self(), 0),
 3593:     {T,Dummy} = receive M -> M after 1000 -> timeout end,
 3594: 
 3595:     {Len,T,Dummy} = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3596:     false = binary_to_term_nif(<<131,100,0,14,"undefined_atom">>,
 3597:                                undefined, ?ERL_NIF_BIN2TERM_SAFE),
 3598:     false = binary_to_term_nif(Bin, undefined, 1),
 3599:     ok.
 3600: 
 3601: nif_port_command(Config) ->
 3602:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3603: 
 3604:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 3605:     true = port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n"),
 3606:     receive {Port,{data,"hello\n"}} -> ok
 3607:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3608: 
 3609:     RefcBin = lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(100, "hello"),"\n"]),
 3610:     true = port_command_nif(Port, iolist_to_binary(RefcBin)),
 3611:     receive {Port,{data,RefcBin}} -> ok
 3612:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3613: 
 3614:     %% Test that invalid arguments correctly returns
 3615:     %% badarg and that the port survives.
 3616:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, [ok])),
 3617: 
 3618:     IoList = [lists:duplicate(100,<<"hello">>),"\n"],
 3619:     true = port_command_nif(Port, [IoList]),
 3620:     FlatIoList = binary_to_list(iolist_to_binary(IoList)),
 3621:     receive {Port,{data,FlatIoList}} -> ok
 3622:     after 1000 -> ct:fail(timeout) end,
 3623: 
 3624:     port_close(Port),
 3625: 
 3626:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch port_command_nif(Port, "hello\n")),
 3627:     ok.
 3628: 
 3629: nif_snprintf(Config) ->
 3630:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3631:     <<"ok",0>> = format_term_nif(3,ok),
 3632:     <<"o",0>>  = format_term_nif(2,ok),
 3633:     <<"\"hello world\"",0>> = format_term_nif(14,"hello world"),
 3634:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},3.14",_/binary>> = format_term_nif(50,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3635:     <<"{{hello,world,-33},",0>> = format_term_nif(20,{{hello,world, -33}, 3.14, self()}),
 3636:     ok.
 3637: 
 3638: nif_internal_hash(Config) ->
 3639:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3640:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal),
 3641:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3642:     HashValues = [hash_nif(internal, Term, 0) || Term <- Terms],
 3643:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3644: 
 3645: nif_internal_hash_salted(Config) ->
 3646:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3647:     test_salted_nif_hash(internal).
 3648: 
 3649: nif_phash2(Config) ->
 3650:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3651:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2),
 3652:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3653:     HashValues =
 3654:         lists:map(
 3655:           fun (Term) ->
 3656:                   HashValue = erlang:phash2(Term),
 3657:                   Salt = random_uint32(), % phash2 should ignore salt
 3658:                   NifHashValue = hash_nif(phash2, Term, Salt),
 3659:                   (HashValue =:= NifHashValue
 3660:                    orelse ct:fail("Expected: ~p\nActual:   ~p",
 3661:                                   [HashValue, NifHashValue])),
 3662:                   HashValue
 3663:           end,
 3664:           Terms),
 3665:     test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize).
 3666: 
 3667: test_salted_nif_hash(HashType) ->
 3668:     HashValueBitSize = nif_hash_result_bitsize(HashType),
 3669:     Terms = unique([random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 500)]),
 3670:     Salts = unique([random_uint32() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 50)]),
 3671:     {HashValuesPerSalt, HashValuesPerTerm} =
 3672:         lists:mapfoldl(
 3673:           fun (Salt, Acc) ->
 3674:                   {HashValues, NewAcc} =
 3675:                     lists:mapfoldl(
 3676:                       fun (Term, AccB) ->
 3677:                               HashValue = hash_nif(HashType, Term, Salt),
 3678:                               NewAccB = dict:append(Term, HashValue, AccB),
 3679:                               {HashValue, NewAccB}
 3680:                       end,
 3681:                       Acc,
 3682:                       Terms),
 3683:                   {{Salt, HashValues}, NewAcc}
 3684:           end,
 3685:           dict:new(),
 3686:           Salts),
 3687: 
 3688:     % Test per-salt hash distribution of different terms
 3689:     lists:foreach(
 3690:       fun ({_Salt, HashValues}) ->
 3691:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize)
 3692:       end,
 3693:       HashValuesPerSalt),
 3694: 
 3695:     % Test per-term hash distribution of different salts
 3696:     dict:fold(
 3697:       fun (_Term, HashValues, Acc) ->
 3698:               test_bit_distribution_fitness(HashValues, HashValueBitSize),
 3699:               Acc
 3700:       end,
 3701:       ok,
 3702:       HashValuesPerTerm).
 3703: 
 3704: test_bit_distribution_fitness(Integers, BitSize) ->
 3705:     MaxInteger = (1 bsl BitSize) - 1,
 3706:     OnesPerBit =
 3707:         lists:foldl(
 3708:           fun (Integer, Acc) when Integer >= 0, Integer =< MaxInteger ->
 3709:                   lists:foldl(
 3710:                     fun (BitIndex, AccB) ->
 3711:                             BitValue = (Integer band (1 bsl BitIndex)) bsr BitIndex,
 3712:                             orddict:update_counter(BitIndex, BitValue, AccB)
 3713:                     end,
 3714:                     Acc,
 3715:                     lists:seq(0, BitSize - 1))
 3716:           end,
 3717:           orddict:new(),
 3718:           Integers),
 3719: 
 3720:     N = length(Integers),
 3721:     ExpectedNrOfOnes = N div 2,
 3722:     %% ExpectedNrOfOnes should have a binomial distribution
 3723:     %% with a standard deviation as:
 3724:     ExpectedStdDev = math:sqrt(N) / 2,
 3725:     %% which can be approximated as a normal distribution
 3726:     %% where we allow a deviation of 6 std.devs
 3727:     %% for a fail probability of 0.000000002:
 3728:     MaxStdDevs = 6,
 3729: 
 3730:     FailureText =
 3731:         orddict:fold(
 3732:           fun (BitIndex, NrOfOnes, Acc) ->
 3733:                   Deviation = abs(NrOfOnes - ExpectedNrOfOnes) / ExpectedStdDev,
 3734:                   case Deviation >= MaxStdDevs of
 3735:                       false ->
 3736:                           Acc;
 3737:                       true ->
 3738:                           [Acc,
 3739:                            io_lib:format(
 3740:                              "Unreasonable deviation on number of set bits (i=~p): "
 3741:                              "expected ~p, got ~p (# std.dev ~.3f > ~p)~n",
 3742:                              [BitIndex, ExpectedNrOfOnes, NrOfOnes, Deviation, MaxStdDevs])]
 3743:                   end
 3744:           end,
 3745:           [],
 3746:           OnesPerBit),
 3747: 
 3748:     (FailureText =:= [] orelse ct:fail(FailureText)).
 3749: 
 3750: nif_hash_result_bitsize(internal) -> 32;
 3751: nif_hash_result_bitsize(phash2) -> 27.
 3752: 
 3753: unique(List) ->
 3754:     lists:usort(List).
 3755: 
 3756: random_uint32() ->
 3757:     rand:uniform(1 bsl 32) - 1.
 3758: 
 3759: random_term() ->
 3760:     case rand:uniform(6) of
 3761:         1 -> rand:uniform(1 bsl 27) - 1; % small
 3762:         2 -> (1 bsl 27) + rand:uniform(1 bsl 128); % big
 3763:         3 -> random_sign() * (rand:uniform() * (1 bsl 53)); % float
 3764:         4 -> random_binary();
 3765:         5 -> random_pid();
 3766:         6 ->
 3767:             Length = rand:uniform(10),
 3768:             List = [random_term() || _ <- lists:seq(1, Length)],
 3769:             case rand:uniform(2) of
 3770:                 1 ->
 3771:                    List;
 3772:                 2 ->
 3773:                    list_to_tuple(List)
 3774:             end
 3775:     end.
 3776: 
 3777: random_sign() ->
 3778:     case rand:uniform(2) of
 3779:         1 -> -1.0;
 3780:         2 -> 1.0
 3781:     end.
 3782: 
 3783: random_binary() ->
 3784:     rand:bytes(rand:uniform(32) - 1).
 3785: 
 3786: random_pid() ->
 3787:     Processes = erlang:processes(),
 3788:     lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Processes)), Processes).
 3789: 
 3790: %% Test enif_whereis_...
 3791: 
 3792: nif_whereis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3793:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3794: 
 3795:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_thing,
 3796:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3797:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3798: 
 3799:     Mgr = self(),
 3800:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3801:     ProcMsg = {Ref, ?LINE},
 3802:     PortMsg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis hello\n",
 3803: 
 3804:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [Ref]),
 3805:     true = register(RegName, Pid),
 3806:     Pid = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3807:     Pid = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3808:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3809:     false = whereis_term(pid, [RegName]),
 3810: 
 3811:     ok = whereis_send(pid, RegName, {forward, Mgr, ProcMsg}),
 3812:     ok = receive ProcMsg -> ok end,
 3813: 
 3814:     Pid ! {Ref, quit},
 3815:     ok = receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> ok end,
 3816:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3817:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3818: 
 3819:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 3820:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 3821:     Port = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3822:     Port = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3823:     false = whereis_term(pid, RegName),
 3824:     false = whereis_term(port, [RegName]),
 3825: 
 3826:     ok = whereis_send(port, RegName, PortMsg),
 3827:     ok = receive {Port, {data, PortMsg}} -> ok end,
 3828: 
 3829:     port_close(Port),
 3830:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3831:     false = whereis_term(port, RegName),
 3832:     ok.
 3833: 
 3834: nif_whereis_parallel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3835:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3836: 
 3837:     %% try to be at least a little asymmetric
 3838:     NProcs = trunc(3.7 * erlang:system_info(schedulers)),
 3839:     NSeq = lists:seq(1, NProcs),
 3840:     Names = [list_to_atom("nif_whereis_proc_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
 3841:             || N <- NSeq],
 3842:     Mgr = self(),
 3843:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3844: 
 3845:     NotReg = fun(Name) ->
 3846:         erlang:whereis(Name) == undefined
 3847:     end,
 3848:     PidReg = fun({Name, Pid, _Mon}) ->
 3849:         erlang:whereis(Name) == Pid andalso whereis_term(pid, Name) == Pid
 3850:     end,
 3851:     RecvDown = fun({_Name, Pid, Mon}) ->
 3852:         receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, normal} -> true
 3853:         after   1500 -> false end
 3854:     end,
 3855:     RecvNum = fun(N) ->
 3856:         receive {N, Ref} -> true
 3857:         after   1500 -> false end
 3858:     end,
 3859: 
 3860:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 3861: 
 3862:     %% {Name, Pid, Mon}
 3863:     Procs = lists:map(
 3864:         fun(N) ->
 3865:             Name = lists:nth(N, Names),
 3866:             Prev = lists:nth((if N == 1 -> NProcs; true -> (N - 1) end), Names),
 3867:             Next = lists:nth((if N == NProcs -> 1; true -> (N + 1) end), Names),
 3868:             {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 3869:                 ?MODULE, nif_whereis_proxy, [{N, Ref, Mgr, [Prev, Next]}]),
 3870:             true = register(Name, Pid),
 3871:             {Name, Pid, Mon}
 3872:         end, NSeq),
 3873: 
 3874:     true = lists:all(PidReg, Procs),
 3875: 
 3876:     %% tell them all to 'fire' as fast as we can
 3877:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 3878:                        [P ! {Ref, send_proc} || {_, P, _} <- Procs]
 3879:                end, void),
 3880: 
 3881:     %% each gets forwarded through two processes
 3882:     repeat(10, fun(_) ->
 3883:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq),
 3884:                        true = lists:all(RecvNum, NSeq)
 3885:                end, void),
 3886: 
 3887:     %% tell them all to 'quit' by name
 3888:     [N ! {Ref, quit} || {N, _, _} <- Procs],
 3889:     true = lists:all(RecvDown, Procs),
 3890:     true = lists:all(NotReg, Names),
 3891:     ok.
 3892: 
 3893: nif_whereis_threaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3894:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3895: 
 3896:     RegName = nif_whereis_test_threaded,
 3897:     undefined = erlang:whereis(RegName),
 3898: 
 3899:     Self = self(),
 3900:     true = register(RegName, Self),
 3901: 
 3902:     {ok, ProcThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(pid, RegName, "dtor to proc"),
 3903:     {ok, Self} = whereis_thd_result(ProcThr),
 3904: 
 3905:     nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName).
 3906: 
 3907: nif_whereis_threaded_2(RegName) ->
 3908:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 3909:     "dtor to proc" = receive_any(1000),
 3910:     true = unregister(RegName),
 3911: 
 3912:     Port = open_port({spawn, echo_drv}, [eof]),
 3913:     true = register(RegName, Port),
 3914: 
 3915:     {ok, PortThr} = whereis_thd_lookup(port, RegName, "dtor to port"),
 3916:     {ok, Port} = whereis_thd_result(PortThr),
 3917: 
 3918:     nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port).
 3919: 
 3920: nif_whereis_threaded_3(Port) ->
 3921:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 3922:     {Port, {data, "dtor to port"}} = receive_any(1000),
 3923: 
 3924:     port_close(Port),
 3925:     ok.
 3926: 
 3927: %% exported to be spawned by MFA by whereis tests
 3928: nif_whereis_proxy({N, Ref, Mgr, Targets} = Args) ->
 3929:     receive
 3930:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 3931:             To ! Data,
 3932:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 3933:         {Ref, quit} ->
 3934:             ok;
 3935:         {Ref, send_port} ->
 3936:             Msg = ?MODULE_STRING " whereis " ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ "\n",
 3937:             lists:foreach(
 3938:                 fun(T) ->
 3939:                     ok = whereis_send(port, T, Msg)
 3940:                 end, Targets),
 3941:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args);
 3942:         {Ref, send_proc} ->
 3943:             lists:foreach(
 3944:                 fun(T) ->
 3945:                     ok = whereis_send(pid, T, {forward, Mgr, {N, Ref}})
 3946:                 end, Targets),
 3947:             nif_whereis_proxy(Args)
 3948:     end;
 3949: nif_whereis_proxy(Ref) ->
 3950:     receive
 3951:         {forward, To, Data} ->
 3952:             To ! Data,
 3953:             nif_whereis_proxy(Ref);
 3954:         {Ref, quit} ->
 3955:             ok
 3956:     end.
 3957: nif_ioq(Config) ->
 3958:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 3959: 
 3960:     Script =
 3961:         [{create, a},
 3962: 
 3963:          %% Test enq of erlang term binary
 3964:          {enqb,   a},
 3965:          {enqb,   a, 3},
 3966: 
 3967:          %% Test enq of non-erlang term binary
 3968:          {enqbraw,a},
 3969:          {enqbraw,a, 5},
 3970:          {peek,   a},
 3971:          {peek_head,  a},
 3972:          {deq,    a, 42},
 3973: 
 3974:          %% Test enqv
 3975:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 3976:          {peek_head,  a},
 3977:          {deq,    a, all},
 3978: 
 3979:          %% This skips all elements but one in the iolist
 3980:          {enqv,   a, 5, iolist_size(nif_ioq_payload(5)) - 1},
 3981:          {peek_head,  a},
 3982:          {peek,   a},
 3983: 
 3984:          %% Ensure that enqueued refc binaries are intact after a roundtrip.
 3985:          %%
 3986:          %% This test and the ones immediately following it does not go through
 3987:          %% erlang:iolist_to_iovec/1
 3988:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 3989:          {peek,   a},
 3990: 
 3991:          %% ... heap binaries
 3992:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 3993:          {peek,   a},
 3994: 
 3995:          %% ... plain sub-binaries
 3996:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(subbin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 3997:          {peek,   a},
 3998: 
 3999:          %% ... unaligned binaries
 4000:          {enqv,   a, [nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) || _ <- lists:seq(1,20)], 0},
 4001:          {peek,   a},
 4002: 
 4003:          %% Enq stuff to destroy with data in queue
 4004:          {enqv,   a, 2, 100},
 4005:          {destroy,a},
 4006: 
 4007:          %% Test destroy of new queue
 4008:          {create, a},
 4009:          {destroy,a}
 4010:         ],
 4011: 
 4012:     nif_ioq_run(Script),
 4013: 
 4014:     %% Test that only enif_inspect_as_vec works
 4015:     Payload = nif_ioq_payload(5),
 4016:     PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(Payload),
 4017: 
 4018:     [begin
 4019:          PayloadBin = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,Payload,Stack,Env)),
 4020:          <<>>       = iolist_to_binary(ioq_nif(inspect,[],Stack,Env))
 4021:      end || Stack <- [no_stack, use_stack], Env <- [use_env, no_env]],
 4022: 
 4023:     %% Test error cases
 4024: 
 4025:     Q = ioq_nif(create),
 4026: 
 4027:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4028: 
 4029:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(deq, Q, 1)),
 4030:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, 1, 1234)),
 4031: 
 4032:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4033: 
 4034:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [atom_in_list], 0)),
 4035:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [make_ref()], 0)),
 4036:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [256], 0)),
 4037:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [-1], 0)),
 4038:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [#{}], 0)),
 4039:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [1 bsl 64], 0)),
 4040:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(enqv, Q, [{tuple}], 0)),
 4041: 
 4042:     false = ioq_nif(peek_head, Q),
 4043: 
 4044:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [atom_in_list], use_stack)),
 4045:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [make_ref()], no_stack)),
 4046:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [256], use_stack)),
 4047:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [-1], no_stack)),
 4048:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [#{}], use_stack)),
 4049:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [1 bsl 64], no_stack)),
 4050:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  [{tuple}], use_stack)),
 4051:     {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} = (catch ioq_nif(inspect,  <<"binary">>, use_stack)),
 4052: 
 4053:     ioq_nif(destroy, Q),
 4054: 
 4055:     %% Test that the example in the docs works
 4056:     ExampleQ = ioq_nif(create),
 4057:     true = ioq_nif(example, ExampleQ, nif_ioq_payload(5)),
 4058:     ioq_nif(destroy, ExampleQ),
 4059: 
 4060:     ok.
 4061: 
 4062: 
 4063: nif_ioq_run(Script) ->
 4064:     nif_ioq_run(Script, #{}).
 4065: 
 4066: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name}|T], State)
 4067:   when Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4068:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin}|T], State);
 4069: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, Skip}|T], State)
 4070:   when Action =:= enqb, is_integer(Skip);
 4071:        Action =:= enqbraw, is_integer(Skip) ->
 4072:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, heapbin, Skip}|T], State);
 4073: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N}|T], State)
 4074:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4075:     nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, 0}|T], State);
 4076: nif_ioq_run([{Action, Name, N, Skip}|T], State)
 4077:   when Action =:= enqv; Action =:= enqb; Action =:= enqbraw ->
 4078: 
 4079:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4080:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4081: 
 4082:     %% Sanitize the log output a bit so that it doesn't become too large.
 4083:     H = {Action, Name, try iolist_size(N) of Sz -> Sz catch _:_ -> N end, Skip},
 4084:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4085: 
 4086:     Data = nif_ioq_payload(N),
 4087:     ioq_nif(Action, IOQ, Data, Skip),
 4088: 
 4089:     <<_:Skip/binary, SkippedData/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4090: 
 4091:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == (iolist_size([B|SkippedData])),
 4092: 
 4093:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := Q#{ b := [B|SkippedData]}});
 4094: nif_ioq_run([{peek, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4095:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4096:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4097: 
 4098:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4099: 
 4100:     Data = ioq_nif(peek, IOQ, ioq_nif(size, IOQ)),
 4101: 
 4102:     true = iolist_to_binary(B) == iolist_to_binary(Data),
 4103:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4104: nif_ioq_run([{peek_head, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4105:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4106:     RefData = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4107: 
 4108:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4109: 
 4110:     {true, QueueHead} = ioq_nif(peek_head, IOQ),
 4111:     true = byte_size(QueueHead) > 0,
 4112: 
 4113:     {RefHead, _Tail} = split_binary(RefData, byte_size(QueueHead)),
 4114: 
 4115:     true = QueueHead =:= RefHead,
 4116: 
 4117:     nif_ioq_run(T, State);
 4118: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, all}|T], State) ->
 4119:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4120:     Size = ioq_nif(size, IOQ),
 4121:     true = Size == iolist_size(B),
 4122:     nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, Size}|T], State);
 4123: nif_ioq_run([{deq, Name, N} = H|T], State) ->
 4124:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = Q = maps:get(Name, State),
 4125:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4126: 
 4127:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4128: 
 4129:     <<_:N/binary,Remain/binary>> = iolist_to_binary(B),
 4130:     NewQ = Q#{ b := Remain },
 4131: 
 4132:     Sz = ioq_nif(deq, IOQ, N),
 4133: 
 4134:     true = Sz == iolist_size(Remain),
 4135:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(Remain),
 4136: 
 4137:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name := NewQ });
 4138: nif_ioq_run([{create, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4139:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4140:     nif_ioq_run(T, State#{ Name => #{ q => ioq_nif(create), b => [] } });
 4141: nif_ioq_run([{destroy, Name} = H|T], State) ->
 4142:     #{ q := IOQ, b := B } = maps:get(Name, State),
 4143:     true = ioq_nif(size, IOQ) == iolist_size(B),
 4144: 
 4145:     ct:log("~p", [H]),
 4146: 
 4147:     ioq_nif(destroy, IOQ),
 4148: 
 4149:     nif_ioq_run(T, maps:remove(Name, State));
 4150: nif_ioq_run([], State) ->
 4151:     State.
 4152: 
 4153: nif_ioq_payload(N) when is_integer(N) ->
 4154:     Tail = if N > 3 -> nif_ioq_payload(N-3); true -> [] end,
 4155:     Head = element(1, lists:split(N,[nif_ioq_payload(subbin),
 4156:                                      nif_ioq_payload(heapbin),
 4157:                                      nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4158:                                      nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) | Tail])),
 4159:     erlang:iolist_to_iovec(Head);
 4160: nif_ioq_payload(subbin) ->
 4161:     Bin = nif_ioq_payload(refcbin),
 4162:     Sz = size(Bin) - 1,
 4163:     <<_:8,SubBin:Sz/binary,_/bits>> = Bin,
 4164:     SubBin;
 4165: nif_ioq_payload(unaligned_bin) ->
 4166:     make_unaligned_binary(<< <<I>> || I <- lists:seq(1, 255) >>);
 4167: nif_ioq_payload(heapbin) ->
 4168:     <<"a literal heap binary">>;
 4169: nif_ioq_payload(refcbin) ->
 4170:     iolist_to_binary([lists:seq(1,255) || _ <- lists:seq(1,255)]);
 4171: nif_ioq_payload(Else) ->
 4172:     Else.
 4173: 
 4174: make_unaligned_binary(Bin0) ->
 4175:     Size = byte_size(Bin0),
 4176:     <<0:3,Bin:Size/binary,31:5>> = id(<<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>),
 4177:     Bin.
 4178: 
 4179: pid(Config) ->
 4180:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4181:     Self = self(),
 4182:     {true, ErlNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Self),
 4183:     false = is_pid_undefined_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4184:     Self = make_pid_nif(ErlNifPid),
 4185: 
 4186:     UndefPid = set_pid_undefined_nif(),
 4187:     true = is_pid_undefined_nif(UndefPid),
 4188:     undefined = make_pid_nif(UndefPid),
 4189:     0 = send_term(UndefPid, message),
 4190: 
 4191:     Other = spawn(fun() -> ok end),
 4192:     {true,OtherNifPid} = get_local_pid_nif(Other),
 4193:     Cmp = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, OtherNifPid),
 4194:     true = if Cmp < 0 -> Self < Other;
 4195:               Cmp > 0 -> Self > Other
 4196:            end,
 4197:     0 = compare_pids_nif(ErlNifPid, ErlNifPid),
 4198: 
 4199:     {false, _} = get_local_pid_nif(undefined),
 4200:     ok.
 4201: 
 4202: nif_term_type(Config) ->
 4203:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4204: 
 4205:     atom = term_type_nif(atom),
 4206: 
 4207:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:1>>),
 4208:     bitstring = term_type_nif(<<1:8>>),
 4209: 
 4210:     float = term_type_nif(0.0),
 4211: 
 4212:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun external:function/1),
 4213:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun(A) -> A end),
 4214:     'fun' = term_type_nif(fun id/1),
 4215: 
 4216:     integer = term_type_nif(1 bsl 1024),        %Bignum.
 4217:     integer = term_type_nif(1),
 4218: 
 4219:     list = term_type_nif([list]),
 4220:     list = term_type_nif([]),
 4221: 
 4222:     LargeMap = maps:from_list([{N, N} || N <- lists:seq(1, 256)]),
 4223:     map = term_type_nif(LargeMap),
 4224:     map = term_type_nif(#{ small => map }),
 4225: 
 4226:     pid = term_type_nif(self()),
 4227: 
 4228:     Port = open_port({spawn,echo_drv},[eof]),
 4229:     port = term_type_nif(Port),
 4230:     port_close(Port),
 4231: 
 4232:     reference = term_type_nif(make_ref()),
 4233: 
 4234:     tuple = term_type_nif({}),
 4235: 
 4236:     ok.
 4237: 
 4238: %% Verify match state arguments are not passed to declared NIFs.
 4239: match_state_arg(Config) ->
 4240:     ensure_lib_loaded(Config),
 4241:     Bin = term_to_binary([<<"x">> | Config]), % a non-literal binary with an $x byte
 4242:     <<"nif says ok">> = msa_find_x_y(Bin),
 4243:     ok.
 4244: 
 4245: %% Without declaring msa_find_y_nif/1 as NIF, the compiler would do
 4246: %% optimization and pass it a match state as argument.
 4247: msa_find_x_y(<<$x, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4248:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4249: msa_find_x_y(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4250:     msa_find_x_y(Rest);
 4251: msa_find_x_y(<<>>) ->
 4252:     "no x".
 4253: 
 4254: msa_find_y_nif(<<$y, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4255:     Rest;
 4256: msa_find_y_nif(<<_, Rest/binary>>) ->
 4257:     msa_find_y_nif(Rest);
 4258: msa_find_y_nif(<<>>) ->
 4259:     "no y".
 4260: 
 4261: 
 4262: last_resource_dtor_call() ->
 4263:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, aux_work),
 4264:     last_resource_dtor_call_nif().
 4265: 
 4266: id(I) -> I.
 4267: keep_alive(Term) -> ?MODULE:id(Term).
